messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Internet Privacy (was Mommy...?)
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think that I agree with whoever it was that said that this medium, unfortunately, does not involve large levels of privacy.  A determined individual can
messages.messageBody:
>P. S. I would feel somewhat violated if people could access totally >personal feelingsa such as these , on a search engine...after all >this is somewhat of a support group, and in these type sof groups it >is in the spirit of the groups to assume soem degree of >confidentiality. wouldn't you think? Not that it matters what >someone might think that reads this, but it is rather personal..I >should be able to choose to whom, I 'd like to share it with.

I think that I agree with whoever it was that said that this medium, unfortunately, does not involve large levels of privacy. A determined individual can find access to just about whatever they like on here. The only solution would be not to keep archives, but I think that discourages membership and keeps groups small. I think it is a matter of accepting the limitations of this medium.

Nanci K.
